definitions.definition: a person, team, etc. that has won a competition, especially in a sport

examples.text: the **defending champion** *(= the person who was champion the last time and is trying to be champion again)*
the **reigning champion** *(= the person who is champion now)*
He became the youngest US Open champion for 88 years.
the Commonwealth Games champion in the 5 000 metres
They were champions at the Winter Olympics in Chamonix.
The reigning champion will defend her title tonight.
The two winners will move onto a one-game final to determine the champion.
He was the undisputed heavyweight champion of the world.
She is a former Olympic skating champion.
The double world sprint champion has announced his retirement.

definitions.definition: a person who fights for, or speaks in support of, a group of people or a belief

examples.text: She was a long-term champion of animal rights and environmental protection.
He became a leading champion for victims of miscarriages of justice.
She became best known as a vigorous champion of the rail link.

wordOrigin: Middle English (denoting a fighting man): from Old French, from medieval Latin campio(n-) ‘fighter’, from Latin campus ‘level ground’, specifically applied to the Campus Martius in Rome, used for games, athletic practice, and military drill.
